metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8169 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
automount 5.0.8, when a program map uses certain interpreted languages,uses the calling user's USER and HOME environment variable values insteadof the values for the user used to run the mapped program, which allowslocal users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse program in the user homedirectory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

autofs - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs-hesiod - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs-ldap - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5 - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5-hesiod - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5-ldap - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: autofs package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1').
